description: Female photographers were given poems written by women, to be inspired by and to interpret. Here’s what they wrought.
title: End of Summer Escape, in Poetry and Pictures
title_page: End of Summer Escape, in Poetry and Pictures - The New York Times
text:
Gender Letter helps you keep up with the world, and the women shaping it. Tell me what you think at dearmaya@nytimes.com.
Most of my waking hours are spent writing. Gathering and organizing data, transcribing interviews, parsing piles of information and piecing together a written reflection of the truth, as fully and fairly as possible.
That’s me, the reporter. But I have a secret writing life — one that’s less about concrete facts and more about essence, where I can mine all lyrical possibilities: Poetry.
As a young girl, I started scrawling stanzas on scraps of paper, stuffing the evidence under my mattress, because I was certain that kind of freedom broke some unwritten rules. It did: in the best way.
